page.title: 17CLUBS AND SOCIETIES IN CLYRO
page.content: {CLYRO AND LLOWES SHOW ASSOCIATION} In 1977 Clyro and LLowes Parishes joined to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II. The Association has continued since that time. A Show is now held annually, at Boatside, on the fourth Saturday in August. Wintertime events raise money to run the Show, Whist Drives, Jumble Sales, Cheese and Wine Parties and a Car Boot Sale. On Show Days a marquee houses the best from Local Gardens and Kitchens, Crafts, Wines and a Children's Section. Outdoors are Sports, Sideshows, Livestock Classes, Children's Ponies and a Dog Show. {THE CARNIVAL A fortnight before the Show a Carnival travels from the Primary School to the Baskerville Arms, where a barbecue and dance complete the evening.
